column2: TEXAS DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
column4: Texas

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Do not drive if you are very weary.
column8: Keep your vehicle in good condition.

column2: 2. Aggressive drivers:
column4: tailgate other vehicles and make improper lane changes.

column2: 3. Braking distance is affected by:
column4: the speed your vehicle is traveling.
column8: the condition of your brakes and tires.

column2: 4. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column6: How fit you are. How much alcohol you drink. Your height.
column8: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
column10: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.

column2: 5. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column4: It improves the vehicle stability.
column6: It helps increase your stopping distance.

column2: 6. Your BAC depends on:
column4: your weight.
column8: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: 4-way stop ahead
column10: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 8. Drive below the posted speed limit when:
column4: entering a highway where there are other cars.
column6: others drive below the speed limit.
column8: anything makes conditions less than perfect.
column10: you are on a four lane road.

column2: 9. A flashing red light means:
column4: Go, but yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column6: The same as a STOP sign.
column10: The light will soon change to steady red.

column2: 10. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column4: the road is narrower ahead.

column2: 11. Which shape is a yield sign?
column4: Diamond

column2: 12. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
column4: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)

column2: 13. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: The car on your right.

column2: 14. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: You.

column2: 15. When driving behind a motorcycle:
column4: allow a following distance of at least 4 motorcycle lengths.
column6: allow at least 4 seconds of following distance.
column8: allow at least 2 seconds of following distance.
column10: allow a following distance of at least 2 car lengths.

column2: 16. The sign in the picture:
column4: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column6: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column8: means that you need to stop.
column10: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.

column2: 17. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column6: The same as a green light.
column8: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.

column2: 18. Drivers who eat and drink while driving:
column4: may have trouble controlling their vehicles.

column2: 19. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column4: pedestrians only.

column2: 20. When driving on a wet road:
column4: you should follow the vehicle ahead of you more closely.
column6: as you decrease your speed, the road becomes more slippery.
column8: as you drive faster, your tires may lose traction.
column10: you must be aware that the pavement gets even more slippery when it's been raining for long periods of time.

column2: 21. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column4: maximum speed

column2: 22. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
column8: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.

column2: 23. This sign means:
column4: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
column6: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
column10: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.

column2: 24. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column8: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 25. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column8: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column4: No Turning

column2: 27. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: You must pass the school bus.
column6: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column8: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column10: The bus is about to stop.

column2: 28. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column4: No one.
column10: The driver who does not control the car.

column2: 29. Before turning, you should:
column4: sound your horn to alert the other drivers.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
column4: Mountain trail
